comment.author: 50917462@N00
comment._content: This must have been a survivor's benefit in the week after the Titanic sank on 15 April 1912. According to this NYT article, Cohan (then at the height of his fame) was a big figure in the relief effort, and distributed special charitable editions of the New York American, which I'm guessing are what he's got under his arm. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9B0CE...
